page.title: 07Top Award For Restored Mill
page.content: On Tuesday 11th of June the president of the Suffolk Preservation Society (the Duke of Grafton) was presented with a European award worth 100,000 pounds .At a special ceremony at Pakenham water mill a Europa Nostra Diploma was handed over by the president of Europa Nostra M. Henri de Koster .The mill ceased to work in 1974 .It was bought by the Society in 1978.Since then 100,000 pounds has been spent to restore it to working condition.Much of the money came from public appeal. Pakenham in now unique in Britain in having both a working windmill and watermill. Of the 30 award winning schemes throughout Europe,six were in Great Britain.Pakenham Water Mill is the only winning scheme in East Anglia.
